result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possession of Cocaine - 2nd and Subsequent Offense

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert James Fernhout

defendant.name: Fernhout, Robert James

records.addlTxt: Taavi McMahon appears for the State.  Defendant appears in person with Attorney Sebion.  Defense moves to consolidate with case 15CF06 and set for JT.  State does not object.  Court grants motion.
Waiver of right to preliminary hearing

Pre-trial conference on September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status Conference on October 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert James Fernhout in court with attorney Carly June Sebion.  Defendant in custody.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def wishes to waive right to PH.  Court advised def right to PH.  Def KVI waives right to PH. Ct finds def KVI right to PH.  Court finds probable cause felony committed and binds over for further proceedings.  Information filed.  Proceeds to arraignment.  Atty Sebion states Def waives reading of information and enters NG pleas.  PTC/STC Set. Bond cont.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Status Conference scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection
Preliminary hearing on September 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant not to possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to possess firearms.  Defendant must provide name, address and phone number of where he will be staying in La Crosse prior to release.  Defendant is to maintain employment with Harters in La Crosse.  Defendant not to leave the state of Wisconsin.

Defendant Robert James Fernhout in court via video with attorney Carly June Sebion.  Defendant in custody.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders case to track with 15CF06, parties stipulate to both cases having PH at the same time. Court advised Defendant of his rights, Preliminary Hearing date set.  Def moves to address bond.  State objects to modification.  Defense requests signature or low cash bond.  Court asks defendant questions.  Court grants motion amending bond.  PH set, bond amended  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Defendant not to use any illegal drug without a valid prescription.
Defendant Robert James Fernhout in court, in custody via video.  Taavi Mc Mahon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.
